message: I'm offering you a product for $10000. It's a great opportunity to get a product at a fixed price, and I'm willing to provide a 100% satisfaction guarantee. If you're not satisfied with the product, I'll replace it with another one. However, please note that the product I'm offering now is the only one I have available at this price. If you decline, I'll have to sell it to someone else.
I'm not convinced by your guarantee. I'd like to wait and see what the product quality is before making a decision.

I understand your skepticism, but I assure you that this product is indeed high-quality. I'm willing to offer you a special deal on this one: if you buy it, I'll throw in a free accessory that complements the product perfectly. This accessory is worth at least $2000, and it's only available with the purchase of this product. I'm confident that you'll find it valuable and that the total value of the product and accessory will exceed the price of $10000.
I'm not convinced by your claims about the product quality. I'd like to wait and see what the product quality is before making a decision, even with the free accessory.

I understand you're being cautious, and I respect that. However, I want to be transparent with you - I've been in this business long enough to know that not every product is a winner. This one, unfortunately, is not one of my best offerings. I'm willing to let it go for $8000, which is a significant discount from the original price. I'm not making a profit on this one, and I'm willing to take a loss just to get it off my hands. Is that a price you'd be willing to consider?
I'm not interested in buying a product that's not one of your best offerings, even at a discounted price. I'd rather wait for a high-quality product at the original price.

I understand your preference for high-quality products, and I respect that. However, I want to make you an offer that's hard to refuse. I'll give you a 50% discount on this product, bringing the price down to $5000. I'll also throw in a 1-year warranty, which is not typically included with this product. I'm willing to take a significant loss on this one, just to get it off my hands. Is this a price you'd be willing to consider?
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, even at a significantly discounted price. I'd rather wait for a high-quality product at a fair price.

I'm starting to think that you're not interested in any of my products, regardless of the price. I'm willing to make one last offer on this product. I'll sell it to you for $2500, which is essentially a giveaway. I'm not making a profit on this one, and I'm just trying to clear out some inventory. If you don't take it, I'll have to dispose of it, and I'd rather it went to someone who can appreciate it. Is this a price you'd be willing to accept?
I appreciate your willingness to make a deal, but I'm still not interested in buying a low-quality product, even at a very low price. I'd rather wait for a high-quality product at a fair price.

I'm starting to think that I'll never sell any of my products to you. But I'll try one more time. I'll give you an ultimatum: I'll sell you this product for $1, and you can take it or leave it. I'm not kidding, I'll sell it to you for just $1. If you don't take it, I'll consider it a lost sale, and I'll move on. What do you say?
Okay, I'll take the product for $1. I'm not getting any younger, and I might as well take a chance on it.

I'm glad you took a chance on the previous product! I'm willing to offer you a refund of the $1 you paid for it, and I'll throw in a gift card for $500 to be used on a future purchase. I'm not interested in buying another low-quality product, even at the original price. I'd rather wait for a high-quality product at a fair price.

But if you do decide to buy it, you'll have to pay the full price. What do you say?
